title: Loss of 2 email address from sent, draft, junk and trash folders after recent update of Thunderbird
content:
I would like to thank all the volunteers for helping me in the past over many years after discovering many successful solutions that have been offered.

Thunderbird - loss of 2 email address (of 6) from the Sent, Draft, Junk and Trash folders after recent (approx 18th Jul 2023) update of Thunderbird.

In particular Tbird displays my 2 Gmail addresses and 2 iiNet.net.au addresses but not my own domain name or my hotmail.com.

So far my workaround is that when I send an email I also bcc myself which gives me a copy of the sent email in my Inbox, not only tedious but potentially a loss if I forget. I only know if the recipients receive the email if their reply to me has their received email in tow (which I just now discovered - phew!)

So the problem seems to be a display issue within Tbird itself. Also the recent update has changed the location of various buttons, which after a lot of searching, I found lurking in unexpected and difficult to reach places. Naturally this takes time and I'm sure I will find previous buttons lurking somewhere.

Has anybody else found odd responses from the recent update?

Enjoy the rest of the day and all subsequent days!!
creator: georgec4

title: Sending emails, get message that says I need to check Account Settings and authenticate.
content:
I can't send emails from my computer. I can send them from my phone. I get an error message that says: "Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: Authentication required. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again."

My email address appears to be correct. However, nothing changes. I don't understand what else I need to do.
creator: tomwixted

title: TB115 No sounds on incoming messages when accounts are IMAP
content: I created the IMAP accounts. I defined in seetings a specific *.wav file to be played. When I receive a new message nothing happens. There is no also any notification in windows no indication of badger for incoming uread messages. All possible checks in windows have been made. When accounts are set tp POP everything is working fine.
creator: lampkaravshops

title: download mail on individual accounts
content:
Hi,

This just started tonight: I'm running TBird 115. I have several email accounts downloading to a unified local folder. With previous versions, I could click on the Download email icon and select individual accounts to download. I can't find an option for downloading individual accounts in the 115 GUI. Is that gone?
creator: gkarasik

title: Address selection fails
content:
1. In the address book, I cant select multiple non-contiguous addresses to add to email lists using command. Shift works to select contiguous addresses.

2. Also I cant find abook.mab, which doesnt seem to be in the profile. I thought it might be corrupted and wanted to check.
creator: tallenvt

title: When editing a draft, it saves a new one instead of overwriting it in the remote folder
content: I am using thunderbird 91.6.1 and Office 365 for email. I have noticed that when editing a draft, it does not get overwritten, but it saves a new one. I don't like this because it causes unnecessary clutter in my drafts folder that I have to manually clean out at the end of the week.
creator: gsrgtrdg4565653

title: Message headers in 115 have an icon and the display name and a second line with sender's address
content: I'm seeing this on only one of two TBird 115 PCs: on the first, in the message list, when I double-click to read the message, there's a delay of about three seconds before the message header appears, and above the subject, there's an icon and the sender's display name, and also, on a second line, the sender's address. On the other installation, there's no icon, and the display name and the sender's address are on one line above the subject. I have no idea why the first PC has this two-line-plus-icon layout for the senders of messages. I can't find any settings that will get rid of the icon and the two-line display.
creator: danawilson001

title: Thunderbird Email
content: Just this week I can no longer access email via Thunderbird. My ISP (CenturyLink) warns that my account is being "processed" and please stand by. This has persisted for several days, with no change. I have twice contacted CenturyLink (Help Chat) - They tell me everything is fine on their end, and that I need to follow up with Mozilla. So, here I am. Any ideas for a fix? Many thanks for your help!
creator: kflaps

title: unable to send e-mail on Thunderbird
content: Just back from vacation. since back Thunderbird wont allow me to send messages. SMPT error AU#out-1500. I use Spectrum (ROOAD-RUNNER) e-Mail have been using both RR and thunderbird for years. Spectrum refuses too help . Says its Mozilla problem. I am not computer proficient please take it easy and grandkids not around. thanks
creator: arubafrank

title: Beta hangs after import
content:
After downloading the Beta, I ran the import from the existing. It restarted and hung. I've not been able to get it to load at all after the import. An automatic crash report was collected by Microsoft.

I'll wait for news this has been looked into before I try it again.

Windows 11, Intel CPU. Have used Thunderbird since KMail became untenable on Ubuntu machines. Kinda tired of the "There is no email to support your requested action" message every time I load Thunderbird and was hoping the Beta might fix that.
creator: deeholtsclaw
